revised_title: Anniversary Address: Celebrating the Lives and Contributions of Fellows
tldr: In his 1941 Anniversary Address, Sir Henry Dale honors the lives and contributions of several Royal Society Fellows who passed away during the previous year. The address highlights their significant work in various scientific fields, including mathematics, engineering, and biology, and acknowledges their impact on the development of science and technology.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > History of Science
